text: The Co-operative Commonwealth Federation (CCF) (, from 1955 the ) was a political party in Canada. It was a social-democratic and democratic-socialist party. Multiple groups helped form the CCF in 1932, in Calgary, Alberta. In 1961, it was succeeded by the New Democratic Party. == References == Category:1930s establishments in Canada Category:1932 establishments in North America Category:20th-century disestablishments in Canada Category:1961 disestablishments Category:Political parties in Canada Category:Social democratic parties Category:Organizations based in Alberta
title: Co-operative Commonwealth Federation
